meanings.definition: A groove or furrow in the ground, especially one made by the wheels of vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The tractor left deep ruts in the muddy field.
meanings.sent2: The car got stuck in the ruts on the dirt road.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy jumped in and out of the ruts, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her life seemed stuck in the same ruts, going nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The ruts in the sand told a story of the passing wagon.

meanings.sent1: Every morning, he followed the same ruts: wake up, eat breakfast, go to work.
meanings.sent2: She felt trapped in the ruts of her monotonous daily life.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about getting stuck in the ruts of bad knock-knock jokes.
meanings.sent4: Breaking free from the ruts of tradition, she decided to travel the world.
meanings.sent5: The ruts of habit were hard to change, but she managed to create new routines.
